Hematology.name: Complete Blood Count (CBC)
Hematology.overview: CBC measures red blood cells, white blood cells, hemoglobin, hematocrit, and platelets to assess overall hematologic health.

Hematology.name: Hemoglobin (Hb)
Hematology.overview: Hemoglobin is the oxygen-carrying protein in red blood cells; low levels indicate anemia.

Hematology.name: Hematocrit (Hct)
Hematology.overview: Hematocrit measures the percentage of blood volume occupied by red blood cells.
Hematology.procedure: Centrifugation or calculated from RBC count and MCV

Hematology.name: Red Blood Cell Count (RBC)
Hematology.overview: RBC count measures the number of erythrocytes per microliter of blood.

Hematology.name: Mean Corpuscular Volume (MCV)
Hematology.overview: MCV reflects the average size of red blood cells; used to classify anemia.

Hematology.name: Mean Corpuscular Hemoglobin (MCH)
Hematology.overview: MCH measures the average amount of hemoglobin per red blood cell.

Hematology.name: Mean Corpuscular Hemoglobin Concentration (MCHC)
Hematology.overview: MCHC measures the concentration of hemoglobin in a given volume of packed RBCs.

Hematology.name: Red Cell Distribution Width (RDW)
Hematology.overview: RDW measures variation in red blood cell size (anisocytosis).
Hematology.procedure: Coefficient of variation of RBC volume

Hematology.name: White Blood Cell Count (WBC)
Hematology.overview: WBC count measures total leukocytes; elevated in infection or inflammation.

Hematology.name: Neutrophil Count
Hematology.overview: Neutrophils are the first responders to bacterial infection.

Hematology.name: Lymphocyte Count
Hematology.overview: Lymphocytes mediate adaptive immunity; elevated in viral infections.

Hematology.name: Monocyte Count
Hematology.overview: Monocytes differentiate into macrophages and dendritic cells in tissues.

Hematology.name: Eosinophil Count
Hematology.overview: Eosinophils are involved in allergic reactions and parasitic infections.

Hematology.name: Basophil Count
Hematology.overview: Basophils release histamine and heparin; rarely elevated.

Hematology.name: Platelet Count
Hematology.overview: Platelets are essential for primary hemostasis and clot formation.

Hematology.name: Peripheral Blood Smear
Hematology.overview: Microscopic examination of blood cells to assess morphology and detect abnormalities.

Hematology.name: Reticulocyte Count
Hematology.overview: Reticulocytes are immature RBCs; reflect bone marrow response to anemia.
Hematology.procedure: Supravital staining (e.g., new methylene blue) or flow cytometry

Hematology.name: Reticulocyte Production Index (RPI)
Hematology.overview: Corrects reticulocyte count for premature release and anemia severity.
Hematology.procedure: Calculated from reticulocyte %, Hct, and maturation time

Hematology.name: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR)
Hematology.overview: ESR measures how quickly RBCs settle; non-specific marker of inflammation.

Hematology.name: C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
Hematology.overview: CRP is an acute-phase reactant that rises rapidly in inflammation.

Hematology.name: High-Sensitivity CRP (hs-CRP)
Hematology.overview: hs-CRP detects low-grade inflammation for cardiovascular risk assessment.

Hematology.name: Serum Iron
Hematology.overview: Measures circulating iron bound to transferrin.

Hematology.name: Total Iron-Binding Capacity (TIBC)
Hematology.overview: TIBC measures the total amount of iron that transferrin can bind.

Hematology.name: Transferrin Saturation
Hematology.overview: Percentage of transferrin saturated with iron; key for iron status assessment.

Hematology.name: Ferritin
Hematology.overview: Ferritin reflects iron stores; low in deficiency, high in inflammation or overload.

Hematology.name: Haptoglobin
Hematology.overview: Haptoglobin binds free hemoglobin; low in hemolysis.

Hematology.name: Lactate Dehydrogenase (LDH)
Hematology.overview: LDH is released during cell damage; elevated in hemolysis, liver disease, or malignancy.

Hematology.name: Indirect Bilirubin
Hematology.overview: Unconjugated bilirubin; elevated in hemolysis or impaired conjugation.

Hematology.name: Direct Antiglobulin Test (DAT / Direct Coombs)
Hematology.overview: Detects antibodies or complement bound to RBCs in autoimmune hemolytic anemia.

Hematology.name: Indirect Antiglobulin Test (Indirect Coombs)
Hematology.overview: Detects free antibodies in serum against RBC antigens.
Hematology.procedure: Incubation of patient serum with normal RBCs + Coombs reagent

Hematology.name: Hemoglobin Electrophoresis
Hematology.overview: Separates hemoglobin variants to diagnose thalassemias and sickle cell disease.

Hematology.name: HbA1c (Glycated Hemoglobin)
Hematology.overview: Reflects average blood glucose over 2–3 months; used in diabetes monitoring.

Hematology.name: Blood Group (ABO and Rh Typing)
Hematology.overview: Determines ABO and Rh(D) blood group for transfusion and pregnancy.
Hematology.procedure: Agglutination with anti-A, anti-B, anti-D antibodies

Hematology.name: Antibody Screen (Indirect Coombs for Antibodies)
Hematology.overview: Screens for unexpected alloantibodies in pre-transfusion testing.
Hematology.procedure: Incubation with panel of RBCs of known antigen profile

Hematology.name: Crossmatch
Hematology.overview: Tests compatibility between donor RBCs and recipient serum before transfusion.

Hematology.name: Prothrombin Time (PT)
Hematology.overview: PT assesses extrinsic and common coagulation pathways.
Hematology.procedure: Clotting time after adding tissue factor and calcium

Hematology.name: International Normalized Ratio (INR)
Hematology.overview: Standardizes PT results for anticoagulation monitoring.

Hematology.name: Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT)
Hematology.overview: aPTT assesses intrinsic and common coagulation pathways.
Hematology.procedure: Clotting time after adding contact activator, phospholipid, and calcium

Hematology.name: Thrombin Time (TT)
Hematology.overview: TT measures conversion of fibrinogen to fibrin by thrombin.
Hematology.procedure: Clotting time after adding exogenous thrombin

Hematology.name: Fibrinogen
Hematology.overview: Fibrinogen is a clotting factor synthesized by the liver.

Hematology.name: D-Dimer
Hematology.overview: D-Dimer is a fibrin degradation product; marker of thrombosis and fibrinolysis.

Hematology.name: Factor VIII Assay
Hematology.overview: Measures activity of clotting factor VIII; deficient in Hemophilia A.

Hematology.name: Factor IX Assay
Hematology.overview: Measures activity of clotting factor IX; deficient in Hemophilia B.

Hematology.name: von Willebrand Factor Antigen (vWF:Ag)
Hematology.overview: vWF antigen level; low in von Willebrand disease.

Hematology.name: vWF Ristocetin Cofactor Activity (vWF:RCo)
Hematology.overview: Functional assay of vWF; measures ability to bind platelets.

Hematology.name: Bleeding Time
Hematology.overview: Historical test of platelet function and primary hemostasis (now rarely used).
Hematology.procedure: Time to stop bleeding after standardized skin incision

Hematology.name: Platelet Function Assay (PFA-100/200)
Hematology.overview: Simulates primary hemostasis under high shear stress.
Hematology.procedure: Closure time in collagen/epinephrine or ADP cartridges

Hematology.name: Beta-hCG (Quantitative)
Hematology.overview: Quantitative pregnancy test; detects human chorionic gonadotropin in serum.

Hematology.name: Qualitative Urine hCG
Hematology.overview: Rapid urine test for pregnancy detection.

Hematology.name: Bone Marrow Aspiration
Hematology.overview: Direct sampling of bone marrow for cytology and diagnosis of hematologic disorders.
Hematology.procedure: Needle aspiration from iliac crest or sternum

Hematology.name: Bone Marrow Biopsy
Hematology.overview: Core biopsy to assess marrow architecture and cellularity.
Hematology.procedure: Trephine biopsy from posterior iliac crest

Hematology.name: Flow Cytometry (Immunophenotyping)
Hematology.overview: Identifies cell surface markers to classify leukemias and lymphomas.
Hematology.sample: Whole blood, marrow, or tissue suspension
Hematology.procedure: Fluorescent antibody labeling and laser detection

Hematology.name: Cytogenetic Analysis (Karyotype)
Hematology.overview: Detects chromosomal abnormalities in hematologic malignancies.

Hematology.name: FISH (Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization)
Hematology.overview: Detects specific genetic abnormalities using fluorescent DNA probes.
Hematology.procedure: Hybridization of labeled probes to target DNA

Hematology.name: Molecular Testing (PCR for BCR-ABL)
Hematology.overview: Quantifies BCR-ABL transcript levels in CML monitoring.
low_conditions: Deep molecular response to TKI therapy

Hematology.name: JAK2 V617F Mutation
Hematology.overview: Detects JAK2 mutation in myeloproliferative neoplasms.

Hematology.name: CALR Mutation
Hematology.overview: CALR mutations in JAK2-negative MPNs.

Hematology.name: MPL Mutation
Hematology.overview: MPL mutations in myeloproliferative neoplasms.

Hematology.name: Serum Protein Electrophoresis (SPEP)
Hematology.overview: Separates serum proteins to detect monoclonal gammopathies.

Hematology.name: Immunofixation Electrophoresis (IFE)
Hematology.overview: Identifies type of monoclonal immunoglobulin (IgG, IgA, etc.).

Hematology.name: Serum Free Light Chains (FLC)
Hematology.overview: Measures free kappa and lambda light chains; used in myeloma.

Hematology.name: Urine Protein Electrophoresis (UPEP)
Hematology.overview: Detects Bence Jones protein (free light chains) in urine.

Hematology.name: 24-Hour Urine Protein
Hematology.overview: Quantifies total protein excretion; used in nephrotic syndrome.

Hematology.name: Urine Microalbumin
Hematology.overview: Early marker of diabetic nephropathy or endothelial dysfunction.

Hematology.name: Antinuclear Antibody (ANA)
Hematology.overview: Screening test for systemic autoimmune diseases like SLE.

Hematology.name: Rheumatoid Factor (RF)
Hematology.overview: Autoantibody against Fc portion of IgG; used in RA diagnosis.

Hematology.name: Anti-CCP Antibody
Hematology.overview: Highly specific for rheumatoid arthritis and predicts erosive disease.

Hematology.name: Complement C3
Hematology.overview: C3 is consumed in immune complex diseases like SLE.

Hematology.name: Complement C4
Hematology.overview: C4 is often low in active SLE due to immune complex clearance.

Hematology.name: Anti-dsDNA Antibody
Hematology.overview: Highly specific for SLE and correlates with disease activity.

Hematology.name: Anti-Smith (Anti-Sm) Antibody
Hematology.overview: Highly specific for SLE.

Hematology.name: Anti-Ro/SSA Antibody
Hematology.overview: Associated with Sjögren’s syndrome and neonatal lupus.

Hematology.name: Anti-La/SSB Antibody
Hematology.overview: Often coexists with Anti-Ro in Sjögren’s syndrome.

Hematology.name: p-ANCA (Perinuclear ANCA)
Hematology.overview: Associated with microscopic polyangiitis and ulcerative colitis.

Hematology.name: c-ANCA (Cytoplasmic ANCA)
Hematology.overview: Highly specific for granulomatosis with polyangiitis (Wegener's).

Hematology.name: Total IgE
Hematology.overview: Elevated in allergic disorders and parasitic infections.

Hematology.name: Specific IgE (e.g., to pollen, dust mites)
Hematology.overview: Identifies allergens causing type I hypersensitivity.

Hematology.name: IgG
Hematology.overview: Most abundant immunoglobulin; low levels suggest immunodeficiency.

Hematology.name: IgA
Hematology.overview: IgA deficiency is the most common primary immunodeficiency.

Hematology.name: IgM
Hematology.overview: IgM is the first antibody produced in primary immune response.

Hematology.name: CH50 (Total Hemolytic Complement)
Hematology.overview: Measures functional integrity of classical complement pathway.

Hematology.name: Cryoglobulins
Hematology.overview: Immunoglobulins that precipitate at cold temperatures and cause vasculitis.

Hematology.name: Cold Agglutinin Titer
Hematology.overview: IgM autoantibodies causing hemolysis at low temperatures.

Hematology.name: Sucrose Hemolysis Test
Hematology.overview: Screening test for paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH).

Hematology.name: Flow Cytometry for CD55/CD59
Hematology.overview: Definitive test for PNH; detects deficiency of GPI-anchored proteins.
Hematology.procedure: Fluorescent antibody staining for CD55 and CD59

Hematology.name: Osmotic Fragility Test
Hematology.overview: Increased fragility in hereditary spherocytosis.

Hematology.name: G6PD Assay
Hematology.overview: Measures glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase activity.

Hematology.name: Heinz Bodies
Hematology.overview: Denatured hemoglobin inclusions seen in G6PD deficiency or unstable Hb.

Hematology.name: Sickle Solubility Test
Hematology.overview: Screening test for sickle hemoglobin (HbS).
Hematology.procedure: HbS causes turbidity in reducing solution

Hematology.name: Hemoglobin F (HbF)
Hematology.overview: Fetal hemoglobin; elevated in beta-thalassemia and HPFH.

Hematology.name: Hemoglobin A2 (HbA2)
Hematology.overview: Elevated in beta-thalassemia trait.

Hematology.name: Methylmalonic Acid (MMA)
Hematology.overview: More sensitive for early B12 deficiency than serum B12.

Hematology.name: Homocysteine
Hematology.overview: Elevated in B12/folate deficiency and is a risk factor for thrombosis.
